Class ScreenManager

java.lang.Object
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.ScreenManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ScreenManager extends Object implements Runnable
This class manages the navigation between various screens. It keeps track of the current screen and a stack of previous screens for handling back navigation.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • ScreenManager

      public ScreenManager(Screen mainScreen, ConsoleInterface consoleInterface)
      Constructor to initialize the ScreenManager with a main (initial) screen and the console interface. The main screen is set as the current screen, and navigation begins.
      Parameters:
      mainScreen - The initial screen that will be displayed when the application starts.
      consoleInterface - The console interface used to display the screens and handle input/output operations.

  • Method Details

    • setApplicationHandle

      protected void setApplicationHandle(ApplicationHandle applicationHandle)

    • newScreen

      protected void newScreen(Screen newScreen)
      Start a new Screen with a new navigation stack
      Parameters:
      newScreen - the initial screen to display

    • doNotLoopScreen

      protected void doNotLoopScreen()
      Do not display the screen again and will instead end the application once the screen exit

    • displayScreen

      public void displayScreen(Screen nextScreen)
      Display the current Screen and push the screen to the navigation stack calls the necessary lifecycle methods.
      Parameters:
      nextScreen - The screen to display.

    • navigateToScreen

      public void navigateToScreen(Screen nextScreen)
      Navigates to the specified Screen. It sets the new Screen as the current screen, adds it to the Screen stack, and calls the necessary lifecycle methods.
      Parameters:
      nextScreen - The screen to navigate to.

    • navigateBack

      public void navigateBack()
      Navigates back to the previous screen. It pops the current screen off the stack, sets the previous screen as the current screen, and calls the necessary lifecycle methods.

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
